business.headline: Personal loan for wedding? Why borrowing for the big day needs rethinkingA wedding is a beautiful milestone, but is it worth starting your new life under a mountain of debt? With the rising trend of using personal loans to fund lavish celebrations, it's time to rethink the cost of saying "I do."

Explained: Why India shouldn't lose sleep over Trump's 25% tariffsIndia shouldn't trade its future for short-term calm. Trump's tariff move is more noise than policy. Staying firm now will protect India's strength and choices in the long run.

May consider dividends to citizens: Trump on tariff revenue disbursal plansTrump has signed a new executive order that imposes fresh import tariffs on goods from 69 countries and the European Union, which will come into effect on August 7.

Loan fraud case: ED issues lookout notice against Anil AmbaniA lookout circular has been issued against Anil Ambani at the request of the Enforcement Directorate (ED), preventing him from travelling abroad without court permission.

Anil Ambani faces lookout notice in Rs 3,000-crore loan fraud caseAnil Ambani can now no longer travel outside India without court permission. This comes after a series of crackdowns on his business entities, allegations of fraud against his firms, and a summons issued by a federal agency.
Vandana Vasudevan on how tech is reshaping daily lifeSpeaking with Business Today's Sakshi Batra, OTP Please author Vandana Vasudevan explains how this shift is changing daily routines.

OTP Please! The double-edged sword of digital living: Vandana VasudevanSpeaking with Business Today's Sakshi Batra, OTP Please author Vandana Vasudevan tells how tech has changed how we live, making travel easier for the disabled, food more accessible, and work more flexible. But she warns of fading community bonds, unhealthy habits, and insecure gig jobs. Tech must support life, not replace human connection.

US tariffs will not have significant adverse impact on Indian economy: SourcesThe 25% tariff announced by US President Donald Trump will not have a significant adverse impact on the Indian economy, government sources said.

Elon Musk's Starlink to operate soon in India. Check monthly plansUnion Telecom Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia confirmed that Starlink has been awarded a Unified Licence to launch its satellite internet operations in India.
Sensex closes 586 points lower, Nifty below 25,600; Infosys ends 3% downThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 585.67 points to close at 80,599.91, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 203 points to end at 24,565.35.

CA explains why you should not use FDs as an emergency fundAccording to RBI guidelines, banks can charge up to 0.5% to 1.0% of the interest rate as a penalty if FDs are broken before their maturity period.

Indian interests top priority, no chance of compromising due to US tariffs: SourcesAn official said that the government is closely watching the developments but sees no reason for alarm after the US imposed a 25% tariff on India.

entertainment.headline: Mahavatar Narasimha continues unstoppable run, mints Rs 50 crore in HindiFilmmaker Ashwin Kumar's 'Mahavatar Narsimha', an animated film, is continuing to engage audiences in theatres despite stiff competition. The film hit the Rs 50 crore-mark nett in Hindi on its second Saturday at the box office.

Not just 2-part film, Ramayana is now available as an AI series'Ramayana' is being remade into a limited series using Artificial Intelligence (AI). The trailer for the series was released a few days ago and the first episode is now available for viewing.

Tamannaah on beauty procedures: Easy to judge people in media glareActor Tamannaah Bhatia opened up about beauty treatments amongst celebrities in the Indian film industry. In a conversation with The Lallantop, she said it is very easy to talk about people who are in the media glare.

Your harshest words sharpen me: Ajith Kumar to critics after 33 years in cinemaAjith Kumar marks 33 years in the film industry with gratitude and resilience. He shares insights on overcoming challenges in cinema and motor racing while thanking fans and family.

Tamannaah Bhatia reacts to wedding rumours with Pak cricketer Abdul RazzaqActor Tamannaah Bhatia addressed marriage rumours with Pakistani cricketer Abdul Razzaq that made headlines in 2020. She said that the Internet got them married for a brief time.

Looks like one of us: Aneet Padda's LinkedIn profile garners praise from fansSocial media users came across the LinkedIn profile of actor Aneet Padda as her film 'Saiyaara' breaks records at the box office. The profile reveals that Padda studied Political Science at Delhi University's Jesus and Mary College.

Ankita Lokhande appeals to public after house-help's daughter goes missingActor Ankita Lokhande appealed for help after her house-help's daughter and friend disappeared. She stated that an FIR has been registered by the Mumbai police.

Tamannaah on Aaj Ki Raat's fame: Mothers tell me toddlers eat listening to the songActor Tammannah Bhatia talked about the recognition that came with her hit dance number 'Aaj Ki Raat' from 'Stree 2'. She said in an exclusive with The Lallantop that several mothers told her that their child would eat food only if they heard the song.

Dhadak 2 is punch in the gut, Raj Kapoor, Bimal Roy used to do this: Anurag KashyapAnurag Kashyap likend 'Dhadak 2' to films by Raj Kapoor and Bimal Roy, highlighting its social relevance in an Instagram post. He appreciated the cast and crew of the film.

Farah Khan flags fake Instagram profile impersonating her cook Dilip, warns actionFilmmaker Farah Khan, on Sunday, issued a warning against a fake Instagram account impersonating her cook Dilip. The account falsely claimed to be a blogger and used Khan's name.

Kingdom box office Day 3: Vijay Deverakonda's film sees mild recovery on SaturdayActor Vijay Deverakonda's film 'Kingdom' crossed Rs 30 crore nett in India in three days. The film features a star-studded cast and is directed by Gowtam Tinnanuri of 'Jersey' fame.

Hrithik Roshan's moves to Aavan Jaavan light up Internet in viral videoActor Hrithik Roshan's danced to 'War 2' song 'Aavan Jaavan' at an event in Sri Lanka and the video is now going viral. The much-anticipated film 'War 2' will release on August 14.

Saiyaara box office Day 16: Ahaan-Aneet's film sees Saturday growthDirector Mohit Suri's 'Saiyaara' edges closer to Rs 300 crore nett with a strong weekend performance. The film features debutants Aneet Padda and Ahaan Panday in lead roles.

Chalti Ka Naam Gaadi: Madhubala and Kishore's defiant dance of joy amidst shadows'Chalti Ka Naam Gaadi' remains a beloved 1958 Bollywood classic starring Madhubala and Kishore Kumar. The film blends humour, music, and family values, reflecting the spirit of post-independence India.

Tamannaah denies rape of Avantika in Baahubali: It's finding herself through a manActor Tamannaah Bhatia, in an interview with The Lallantop, opened up about the controversial scene featuring her and Prabhas in 'Baahubali: The Beginning'. She explained the thought process behind the particular sequence and SS Rajamouli's vision.

Son of Sardaar 2 vs Dhadak 2 box office Day 2: Ajay Devgn's film leads the race'Son of Sardaar 2' emerged as the audience's preferred choice over 'Dhadak 2' despite mixed reviews. Both films were released on Friday. The Ajay Devgn-starrer earned Rs 7.5 crore India nett, while the Siddhant Chaturvedi and Tripti Dimri film collected Rs 3.7 crore India nett on Day 2.

Rajinikanth roasts Coolie director, his self-deprecating jokes win hearts at eventSuperstar Rajinikanth is known for his public speaking skills. At the 'Coolie' audio launch, he made everyone laugh out loud while appreciating and complimenting the cast and crew of the film.

Veteran Tamil actor and comedian Madhan Bob dies at 71 after cancer battleMadhan Bob, renowned Tamil actor and comedian, died at 71 in Chennai. He was undergoing cancer treatment for the past few years.

Gauri Khan, Suhana celebrate SRK, Rani and Karan Johar's National Award winShah Rukh Khan won his first National Award for his performance in 'Jawan'. His wife, Gauri Khan and daughter Suhana celebrated SRK, Rani Mukerji and Karan Johar's win at the 71st National Film Awards.

general news.headline: Not acceptable: Top Trump aide accuses India of financing Russia's war in UkraineStephen Miller, one of Trump's most influential advisors, said that Trump clearly believes India should stop buying oil from Russia. He stated that it is not acceptable for India to continue financing the war by purchasing Russian oil.

Trinamool claims Delhi Police called Bengali a Bangladeshi language, BJP retortsMamata Banerjee shared a letter written by the Lodhi Colony Police Station and was addressed to the Banga Bhawan in Delhi with the subject line reading "Translation of documents containing text written in Bangladeshi language-regarding".

Tejashwi Yadav's dual voter ID row: Poll body issues notice, seeks detailsThe poll body's notice came after the BJP slammed the former Bihar Deputy Chief Minister, alleging that he had committed a crime by keeping "two voter ID cards".

Oval Test cliffhanger fittingly heads into Day 5 with series still on the lineThe Oval Test between India and England extends to a dramatic fifth day after rain played spoilsport in a thrilling final session on Sunday. England need 35 runs to break Indian hearts and win the series 3-1.

How India's native bananas are fighting colonial Cavendish with taste, nutritionThe British-origin Cavendish banana is invading markets across the world and has become the dominant variety sold everywhere. Even in India, Cavendish and its sub-varieties have gained territory, making native varieties like Bihar's Chinia and Assam's Bhimkol harder to spot. From Tamil Nadu to the Northeast, the native kadali phalams are putting up a tough fight. Will desi bananas be able to beat back the colonial Cavendish?

At least 68 refugees and migrants die as boat sinks off Yemen, dozens missingSeventy-four people remain missing after a boat carrying 154 passengers sank off Yemen's coast in the Arabian Sea. Local media reported that rescue teams continue to search for bodies and any possible survivors.

Jaws broken, spine fractured: Army officer thrashes SpiceJet staff over extra feeA senior Army officer allegedly assaulted four SpiceJet employees at Srinagar airport over a cabin baggage dispute, causing serious injuries including a spinal fracture and jaw damage.
Flipkart Freedom Sale: Tablets Get Their Biggest Price Drop of the YearFor buyers looking to invest in a new device, this could be the best chance before the festive season arrives.

Agra-born investor flies on 11-minute space joyride with Bezos's Blue OriginThe launch took place from Launch Site One in West Texas at 6:00 pm (India time), and was live broadcast on Blue Origin's webcast.

PM, Amit Shah meet President amid Parliament logjam, Veep election announcementThese meetings come at a time when the process for electing the next Vice President has formally begun and tensions continue in Parliament over the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) process of the Election Commission in Bihar.

Mani Shankar Aiyar attacks Tharoor with Op Sindoor jab, Congress distances itselfThe delegation visited 33 countries, including the US, to convey to their leadership that India carried out Operation Sindoor strikes in retaliation to the terror attack in the Baisaran Valley, where 26 civilians lost their lives on April 22.

Man who went missing after IndiGo flight assault found at Assam railway stationA man, who had gone missing after being slapped aboard a Mumbai-Kolkata Indigo flight after suffering a panic attack, was found at Assam's Barpeta Road railway station.

Chalti Ka Naam Gaadi: Madhubala and Kishore's defiant dance of joy amidst shadows'Chalti Ka Naam Gaadi' remains a beloved 1958 Bollywood classic starring Madhubala and Kishore Kumar. The film blends humour, music, and family values, reflecting the spirit of post-independence India.

Those lips, that face...: Trump's flirty praise for Karoline Leavitt sparks rowDuring an interview, US President Donald Trump offered unusually personal compliments in response to Leavitt's claim that he deserves the Nobel Peace Prize for brokering multiple ceasefires since returning to office.

Kolkata man dies by suicide, family claims NRC fear; no such mention in noteA 59-year-old man was found hanging at his home in Kolkata. His family has alleged fear of NRC as the reason behind this. However, police said no such reason was found in the suicide note.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

4 of Indian-origin family, missing in US for 5 days, found dead in car crashThe four senior citizens were last seen at a Burger King outlet in Pennsylvania on July 29. They were on their way to the Palace of Gold in Marshall County.

Dharmasthala mass burial case: RTI revelations trigger shocking testimoniesRTI revelations exposing the deletion of death records by Belthangady police have triggered fresh allegations of illegal mass burials, with an eyewitness filing a formal complaint to the SIT. The case, linked to suspected cover-ups and destroyed evidence, may soon lead to exhumation and a full-scale investigation.

UN report finds United Nations reports are not widely readUN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres briefed countries on Friday on the report, produced by his UN80 reform taskforce that focused on how UN staff implement thousands of mandates given to them by bodies like the General Assembly or Security Council.

Ex-IITian says India's 'reality' made her go back to US. Viral post sparks debateDr Rajeshwari Iyer had returned to India, hoping to rebuild her life and give back to her homeland. But that hope, she said, soon wore off.

Who is Mathura Sridharan, Ohio's Indian-origin Solicitor General trolled for 'bindi'?Mathura Sridharan, an Indian-American lawyer, has been appointed as Ohio's 12th Solicitor General, making her the state's top appellate attorney. Her appointment sparked racist backlash online, with trolls targeting her Indian heritage and choice to wear a bindi.

Divya Deshmukh exclusive: Fearless chess, World Cup win, and India's surgeDivya Deshmukh recently created history by winning the Chess World Cup, becoming the youngest player and the first Indian to lift the title. The 19-year-old spoke to India Today about her success, style and the golden era of Indian chess.
SpaceX Crew Dragon reaches ISS in just 15 hours after launchSpaceX's Crew completes the International Space Station mission in 15 hours, carrying astronauts from the US, Japan, and Russia.

Woman dies by suicide after recording video alleging abuse by husband, in-lawsPolice found Sadhna hanging in her room in Sidharth Basti after they received a PCR call around noon reporting a suspected case of suicide, an officer said.

Mahavatar Narasimha continues unstoppable run, mints Rs 50 crore in HindiFilmmaker Ashwin Kumar's 'Mahavatar Narsimha', an animated film, is continuing to engage audiences in theatres despite stiff competition. The film hit the Rs 50 crore-mark nett in Hindi on its second Saturday at the box office.

Tamannaah Bhatia reacts to wedding rumours with Pak cricketer Abdul RazzaqActor Tamannaah Bhatia addressed marriage rumours with Pakistani cricketer Abdul Razzaq that made headlines in 2020. She said that the Internet got them married for a brief time.

sports.headline: Recognition of Siraj thrills bowling coach Morkel: His actions drive the groupIndia's bowling coach Morne Morkel said he was pleased that natural leader Mohammed Siraj was finally receiving the recognition he deserves, praising the pacer's unwavering commitment and consistency throughout the five-match Test series against England.

Lazy decision? Early stumps on Day 4 of Oval Test sparks debateOval Test: Play was called off early on Day 4 due to bad light and a passing shower. England needed 35 runs and India were pushing for four more wickets when wet weather pushed the fifth and final Test into Day 5.

Tired legs, aching body: Krishna and Mohammed defy odds at OvalMohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna delivered exceptional bowling spells to revive India's chances in the final Test at The Oval. Their resilience sparked a thrilling comeback, stirring hope amid tough odds and intense pressure.

Shashi Tharoor missing Virat Kohli in England: Too late to call him out of retirement?Congress MP Shashi Tharoor said that he's missing Virat Kohli in the ongoing Test series in England after India's poor bowling performance on Day 4 of the fifth Test at the Oval.

Oval Test cliffhanger fittingly heads into Day 5 with series still on the lineThe Oval Test between India and England extends to a dramatic fifth day after rain played spoilsport in a thrilling final session on Sunday. England need 35 runs to break Indian hearts and win the series 3-1.

ENG vs IND: Joe Root surpasses Kumar Sangakkara with 39th Test century at OvalStar England batter Joe Root surpassed Kumar Sangakkara with his 39th Test century on Day 4 of the fifth Test against England at the Oval.

Dropped on 19, Harry Brook hurts India with 4th innings century in Oval TestEngland vs India, 5th Test: Harry Brook tore into India's hopes of a series-leveling win with a 90-ball 111 on Sunday. It was the 26-year-old's 10th Test hundred in only his 50th innings.

Jason Holder breaks Bravo's record to become highest wicket-taker for WI in T20IsJason Holder has broken Dwayne Bravo's record for most wickets in T20Is for West Indies after his match-winning performance against Pakistan in the second T20I.

Divya Deshmukh exclusive: Fearless chess, World Cup win, and India's surgeDivya Deshmukh recently created history by winning the Chess World Cup, becoming the youngest player and the first Indian to lift the title. The 19-year-old spoke to India Today about her success, style and the golden era of Indian chess.

Video: Son in tears as Spurs legend receives guard of honour in farewell gameAn emotional Son Heung-min was moved to tears as he bid farewell to Tottenham, in what is expected to have been his final outing in a Spurs shirt against Newcastle United.

Gill's performance in England better than my record of 774 runs: Sunil GavaskarLegendary India batter Sunil Gavaskar has rated Shubman Gill's performance in the ongoing series against England better than his debut series against West Indies in 1971.

Dropped on 19, Harry Brook hurts India with 4th innings century in Oval TestEngland vs India, 5th Test: Harry Brook tore into India's hopes of a series-leveling win with a 90-ball 111 on Sunday. It was the 26-year-old's 10th Test hundred in only his 50th innings.

Jason Holder breaks Bravo's record to become highest wicket-taker for WI in T20IsJason Holder has broken Dwayne Bravo's record for most wickets in T20Is for West Indies after his match-winning performance against Pakistan in the second T20I.

Divya Deshmukh exclusive: Fearless chess, World Cup win, and India's surgeDivya Deshmukh recently created history by winning the Chess World Cup, becoming the youngest player and the first Indian to lift the title. The 19-year-old spoke to India Today about her success, style and the golden era of Indian chess.

Video: Son in tears as Spurs legend receives guard of honour in farewell gameAn emotional Son Heung-min was moved to tears as he bid farewell to Tottenham, in what is expected to have been his final outing in a Spurs shirt against Newcastle United.

Gill's performance in England better than my record of 774 runs: Sunil GavaskarLegendary India batter Sunil Gavaskar has rated Shubman Gill's performance in the ongoing series against England better than his debut series against West Indies in 1971.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
